name: Age group inclusion criterion
definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states an age bracket which, if met, makes an entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: Age of majority inclusion criterion
definition: An inclusion criterion that uses the age of majority for a state or institution, where one is generally considered to be an adult, which if met, makes an individual suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: BMI range inclusion criterion
definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states a Body Mass Index range, which if met, makes an individual suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: Clinically relevant exposure inclusion criterion
definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more clinically relevant histories of exposure of an entity, which, if met, makes the entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: Clinically relevant lifestyle inclusion criterion
definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more clinically relevant planned processes that a human being actively participates in , which, if met, makes the human being suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: Country of residence inclusion criteria
definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more countries of residence which, if met, makes a human being suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: Defined population inclusion criterion
definition: An inclusion criterion that is based on fitting within the defined characteristics of a population based study design.

name: Ethnicity inclusion criterion
definition: An inclusion criteria that defines and states one or more ethnicities which, if met, makes an entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: Family status inclusion criterion
definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more family statuses, which, if met, makes a human being suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: Gravidity inclusion criterion
definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more gravidity statuses of an organism, which, if met, makes the entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: Health status inclusion criterion
definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more clinically significant bodily components, dispositions, and/or bodily processes of an entity that are inferred from relevant clinical findings or self-reported, which, if met, makes the entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: Hospital patient inclusion criterion
definition: An inclusion criterion defines that a human being has to be a hospital patient to be suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: Sex inclusion criterion
definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more sexes which, if met, makes an entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.

name: Use of medication inclusion criterion
definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states a a set of medications, which, if used by an entity, makes that entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.
